titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sugoroku (Japanese Board Games) collection, 1896-circa 1950 RL.11796

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-27 21:51:13 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Sugoroku (Japanese board games) collection
did.abstract: Sugoroku are Japanese games similar to snakes and ladders in the west. Includes 23 sugoroku games (some items are double-sided), primarily dating from the 1910s to 1930s, with a few earlier and later.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: すごろく, or sugoroku, are Japanese games similar to snakes and ladders in the west. In the Meiji, Taisho, and early Showa periods (1890s-1940s and later), sugoroku games were sometimes included as inserts in newspapers and children's magazines.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Sugoroku (Japanese Games) collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sugoroku (Japanese Games) collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Sara Biondi and Tracy M. Jackson, February 2020
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0007,

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Includes 23 sugoroku games (some items are double-sided), primarily dating from the 1910s to 1930s, with a few earlier and later. Many games have a military theme, but others themes include animals, science, and travel.

did.unittitle: 漫画双六 世界早のぞき (Manga sugoroku Sekai hayanzoki)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: Publisher not indicated (likely 新愛知 / Shin-Aichi);
Other names associated: 堤寒三 (Tsutsumi Kanzō - art);

Other Notes: Came as bonus with 新愛知 (Shin-Aichi) (serial title) no. 4129. Appears to be this item: https://www.asiabookroom.com/pages/books/163414/kanzo-tsutsumi/manga-sugoroku-sekai-hayanozoki-a-brief-peek-at-the-world;
Dimensions: 80 x 53 cm;
Date as written: Showa 6

did.unittitle: 飛行機競争双六 (Hikōki kyōsō sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 実業の日本社 (實業之日本社) (Jitsugyō no Nihon-sha);
Other names associated: 明石赤子(Akashi Akako - art), 日本少年編輯局 (Nihon shōnen henshūkyoku - concept);
Summary of Game: Take off and land your plane safely. Two routes (red and blue). Play instructions included on board;
Other Notes: Came as a bonus with 日本少年 (Nihon shōnen) (serial title) volume 7, issue 1;
Date as written: Meiji 45, January

did.unittitle: 勇ましい日本軍双六 (Isamashii Nihon-gun sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 大日本雄弁会 講談社 (Dai-Nihon Yūben-kai Kōdansha);
Other names associated: 伊藤幾久造 (Itō Kikuzō), 飯塚羚児 (Iizuka Reiji - art);
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 幼年倶楽部 (Yōnen kurabu) (serial title) - no issue listed;
Dimensions: 53 x 77 cm;
Date as written: Showa 13

did.unittitle: 動物モノシリ双六 (Dōbutsu monoshiri sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: not indicated on this side;
Other names associated: 古賀忠道 (Koga Tadamichi - guidance), Tokyo Ueno Zoo director , 椛島勝一 (Kabashima Katsuichi - art);
Summary of Game: Sugoroku game with facts about zoo animals, including tigers, kangaroos, eagles, flying fish, etc.;
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 幼年倶楽部 (Yōnen kurabu,) (serial title) - no issue listed;
Dimensions: 53 x 77 cm

did.unittitle: 少年少女譚海 新年号 第ー附録：近代科学戦双六 (Shōnen shōjo tankai shinnengō Dai-ichi furoku: Kindai kagakusen sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: not indicated beyond magazine title (少年少女譚海, Shōnen shōjo tankai);
Other names associated: 村上松次郎 (Murakami Matsujirō - art);
Summary of Game: Games are numbered (two-sided board): #1 first side of board, pictures and dice rolls listed, large circle in center "take-off";
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 少年少女譚海 (Shōnen shōjo tankai) (serial title) volume 16, issue 1;
Date as written: Showa 10

did.unittitle: 少年少女譚海 新年号 第３，４，５附録 (Shōnen shōjo tankai shinnengō Dai-san, yon, go furoku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: Printer listed, but no publisher other than magazine title (Shōnen shōjo tankai);
Other names associated: 村上松次郎 (Murakami Matsujirō - art), 少年少女譚海 (Shōnen shōjo tankai);

Summary of Game: Games are numbered: #3 大空襲爆撃遊戯 (Dai kūshū bakugeki yūgi) (two-player territory control game, rules included); #4 新案マラソン競争遊戯 (Shin'an marason kyōsō yūgi) (race game around outer red track, rules included); #5 猛獣狩点取遊戯 (Mōjū-gari tentori yūgi) (4-player point-taking big game hunting game. Requires 12 cut-out animal cards, not present; rules included on board);
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 少年少女譚海 (Shōnen shōjo tankai) (serial title) volume 16, issue 1;
Date as written: Showa 10

did.unittitle: 戦車双六 (Sensha sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: not indicated;
Other names associated: 陸軍機甲本部 (Rikugun kikō honbu, the Army armored vehicle/tank headquarters - guidance);
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 機械化 (Kikaika) #13 - Duke holds original Kikaika issues;
Dimensions: 20" x 27.5"

did.unittitle: 現代戦車の現れるまで (Gendai no sensha no arawareru made)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: not indicated;
Other names associated: none indicated;
Summary of Game: Diagram of modern tank, images of tanks and armored war vehicles through history. Short text with same title, describing the evolution of the tank;
Other Notes: Bonus with 機械化 (Kikaika) #13 - Duke holds original Kikaika issues;
Dimensions: 20" x 27.5"

did.unittitle: 欧州大戦遊戯 (Ōshū taisen yūgi)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 大日本雄弁会 (Dai-Nihon Yūben-kai);
Other names associated: 小林永二郎 (Kobayashi Eijiro - art), 尺秀三郎 (Seki Hidesaburō - concept);
Summary of Game: Allied forces vs. German (whole board);
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 少年倶楽部 (Shōnen kurabu) (serial title) volume 3, issue 1;
Date as written: Taisho 5, January

did.unittitle: 青島占領双六 (Seitō senryō sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 実業の日本社 (實業之日本社) (Jitsugyō no Nihon-sha);
Other names associated: 有本芳水 (Arimoto Hōsui - guidance), poet; 川端龍子 (Kawabata Ryūshi - art), Nihonga painter;
Other Notes: Came as new year's bonus with 日本少年 (Nihon shōnen) in Taisho 4 (1915);
Dimensions: 21" x 31"

did.unittitle: 軍国飛行双六 (Gunkoku hikō sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 飛行少年研究会 (Hikō shōnen kenkyūkai);
Summary of Game: Sugoroku game featuring major activities/skills of airforce/army aviators. Images include dogfights, sea battles, reconaissance, zepplins, etc.;
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 飛行少年 (Hikō shōnen), volume 2, issue 1, January 1st Taisho 5;
Dimensions: 21.25" x 30.75";
Date as written: 1916 (Taisho 5)

did.unittitle: 原子双六 (Genshi sugoroku (envelope))

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 日本発明新聞社 (Nihon Hatsumei Shinbunsha);
Other names associated: 日本発明新聞社 (Nihon Hatsumei Shinbunsha) (Japan Invention Newspaper) editors - guidance, 下馬三郎 (Shimouma Saburō - art);
Summary of Game: In commemoration of the Nobel prize awarded to Dr. Yukawa (1949);
Other Notes: Original envelope

did.unittitle: 原子双六 (Genshi sugoroku (board))

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 日本発明新聞社 (Nihon Hatsumei Shinbunsha);
Other names associated: none indicated;
Other Notes: Game board;
Dimensions: 75 x 52 cm for game board

did.unittitle: 陸海大激戦双六 (Riku-kai dai-gekisen sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 博文館 (Hakubunkan);
Other names associated: 金子士郎 (Kaneko Shiro - art), 少年世界編輯局 (Shōnen sekai henshūkyoku - concept);
Summary of Game: Sugoroku board game, attached description says "Siberian expedition and occupation" - large color images, numbered;
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 少年世界 (Shōnen sekai) (serial title) volume 33, issue 1;
Date as written: Taisho 6, January

did.unittitle: 甘賀珍助竹刀修業 (Amaga Chinsuke shinai shūgyō)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 博文館 (Hakubunkan);
Other names associated: no other attributions;
Summary of Game: Sugoroku board game about Amaga Chinsuke & shinai (bamboo sword) training - unrelated to reverse-side game. (Only printed in green);
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 少年世界 (Shōnen sekai) (serial title) volume 33, issue 1;
Date as written: Taisho 6, January

did.unittitle: 世界列強競争遊戯 (Sekai rekkyō kyōsō yūgi)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 大日本雄弁会 (printed by 博文館) (Dai-Nihon Yūben-kai (printed by Hakubunkan));
Other names associated: 佐藤信夫 (Satō Nobuo [?] - concept/design);
Summary of Game: "World powers race", 8 countries, playing pieces for military branches/groups, rules of play on board;
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 少年世界 (Shōnen sekai) (serial title) volume 4, issue 1;
Date as written: Taisho 6, January

did.unittitle: 最新兵器双六 (Saishin heiki sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 日光社 (Nikkō-sha);
Other names associated: no other attributions;
Summary of Game: "Cutting-edge weapon sugoroku", each place on the board features a cutting-edge military weapon;
Other Notes: No notes or information about rules or origin present;
Dimensions: 54 x 39 cm

did.unittitle: 貯金双六 (Chokin sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: not indicated;
Other names associated: no other attributions;
Summary of Game: Small sugoroku board about saving money as patriotic duty, route to happiness, and protection in emergencies;
Other Notes: Came as bonus with 安田貯蓄貯金読本 (Yasuda chochiku chokin dokuhon) - 安田貯蓄貯金 (Yasuda Chochiku Ginkō appears to be name of bank);
Dimensions: 11"x15"

did.unittitle: 飛行機双六 (Hikōki sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: スモーヤ 稲葉春吉 (Sumōya Inaba Haruyoshi);
Other names associated: 稲葉春吉 (Inaba Haruyoshi) appears to be the personal name associated with corporate name スモーヤ Sumo-ya / Sumōya;
Summary of Game: Airplane sugoroku, with spaces for refuling, parachuting, night flying, etc.;
Dimensions: 54 x 38 cm

did.unittitle: 支那事變皇軍大勝 (Shina Jihen kogun taisho sugoroku (front))

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 主婦の友 (Shufu no tomo);
Other names associated: 主婦の友編輯局 (Shufu no tomo henshūkyoku - guidance), 嶺田弘 (Mineda Hiroshi - art), illustrator;

Summary of Game: Next to title: 皇軍勇士慰問・銃後家庭慰問 (Kōgun yūshi imon / Jūgo katei imon) "Condolences/sympathy for the brave soldiers of the imperial army, condolences/sympathy for those on the homefront". Sugoroku game about the Sino-Japanese war, interim government of Manchuria, activities supporting the troops at war, etc. Includes un-cut die template and cards with silhouettes of planes, ships, etc.;
Other Notes: Came as a new year's bonus with 主婦の友 for Showa 14, v.23 issue 1.;
Dimensions: 25" x 37"

did.unittitle: お正月の新しい家庭娯楽大特輯 (Oshōgatsu no atarashii katei goraku daitokushū (reverse))

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 主婦の友 (Shufu no tomo);
Other names associated: 永鳥眞雄 (Nagatori Sanao) listed under the coin fortune-telling section;

Summary of Game: Variety of games to play at home, includes small board game in center, games to play as a family at home (including "indoor boat race", "bean-throwing battle", "find the spy", etc - many are war/battle-themed), a fortune-telling chart using coins, and fortune-telling based on zodiac animals;
Other Notes: Came as a new year's bonus with 主婦の友 (Shufu no tomo) Showa 14, v.23 issue 1.;
Dimensions: 25" x 37"

did.unittitle: 日本周遊雙六 (Nihon shūyū sugoroku)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 博文館 (Hakubunkan);
Other names associated: 水野年方 (Mizuno Toshikata - art), ukiyoe-e and Nihonga artist;

Summary of Game: Travel-themed sugoroku with landmarks/famous locations around Japan, including Ise Grand Shrine, Tokyo, Niigata, Nikko, Izumo Grand Shrine, and notably Ryūkyū, Taiwan ("Japan's new territory/holding after the great success of the Sino-Japanese War" with an image of locals waving Japanese flags & imperial soldiers), Chishima (the contested Kuril islands), and Bakan (the Treaty of Shimonoseki);
Dimensions: 24.5" x 35"

did.unittitle: 征空すごろく、世界航空路圖 (Seizora sugoroku, Sekai kōkū michizu)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publisher: 大阪毎日新聞 (Ōsaka Mainichi Shinbun);
Other names associated: No attributions given;

Summary of Game: 新時代教育遊戯 (Shin-jidai kyōiku yūgi - a new-era educational game) (subtitle on upper-right of board). Travel-themed sugoroku with several methods of play (from easier to more difficult, just traveling to major capitols, going all the way around the world, etc.), plus portraits and photos from around the world around edge of board. Play is following major travel routes/famous flights (Graf Zeppelin, Lindbergh, etc.). Upper-right corner features text info about famous flights around the world;
Other Notes: Came as new year's bonus with 大阪毎日新聞 (Osaka Mainichi newspaper), v.1 no. 6755;
Dimensions: 107 x 77 cm
